net.consensys.cava.config

Interface PropertyValidator<T>


  • public interface PropertyValidator<T>
    A validator associated with a specific configuration property.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PropertyValidator<java.lang.Number> inRange(long from, long to)
      A validator that ensures a property is within a long integer range.
      static PropertyValidator<java.lang.Object> isPresent()
      A validator that ensures a property is present.
      java.util.List<ConfigurationError> validate(java.lang.String key, DocumentPosition position, T value)
      Validate a configuration property.

    • Method Detail

      • isPresent

        static PropertyValidator<java.lang.Object> isPresent()
        A validator that ensures a property is present.
        Returns:
        A validator that ensures a property is present.

      • inRange

        static PropertyValidator<java.lang.Number> inRange(long from,
                                                   long to)
        A validator that ensures a property is within a long integer range.
        Parameters:
        from - The lower bound of the range (inclusive).
        to - The upper bound of the range (exclusive).
        Returns:
        A validator that ensures a property is within an integer range.

      • validate

        java.util.List<ConfigurationError> validate(java.lang.String key,
                                            @Nullable
                                            DocumentPosition position,
                                            @Nullable
                                            T value)
        Validate a configuration property.
        Parameters:
        key - The configuration property key.
        position - The position of the property in the input document, if supported. This should be used when constructing errors.
        value - The value associated with the configuration entry.
        Returns:
        A list of errors. If no errors are found, an empty list should be returned.
